::Striker::

Striker swears under his breath. That was not what he had meant. He 
had wanted Spears to actually go and get Prebon, so he could work 
without being watched.

He sighs as he looks at her. "No, you don't, Spears. We'll get out of 
this, don't worry."

He was pacing the cell at this point, trying to think of a way to get 
them both out. He swore under his breath. Why couldn't Prowl be here? 
He was good a plans. Striker turns his mind back to the problem, 
remindning himself that there was no use regretting the unchangeble.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Spears::
> 
> She looked at Striker and nodded.  "That I can do for you."  She 
> opened her link, "Master Prebon, the prisoner Striker wishes an 
> audiance with you."  She looked at Striker, "For your own sake, 
> please don't do anything foolish. It could lead to your 
> termination."  She then looked down, "Or mine." she said in a 
> whisper. She turned her back to the cell door. She whispered, 
"Please 
> forget about me, I belong to Master Prebon now."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > ::Striker::
> > 
> > Striker looks at the chip as Spears turns her head, his eyes 
> > narrowing. One of his shoulder blasters swirls around, getting a 
> lock 
> > on the chip. All it would take is one shot... On low power, it 
> could 
> > melt the chip without damaging Spears too much.
> > 
> > On the other hand, there could be a fool-proof program, that
could 
> > deactivate the bot if the chip was destroyed. Striker sighs. One
> > thing 
> > was for sure, he was not going to kill Spears.
> > 
> > "Report away," he says under his breath, trying to convince 
himself 
> > that it was the chip talking, not Spears. He looks through the 
hole
> > in 
> > the door. There was no choice but to knock out Spears, not if the
> > chip 
> > would make her run and tell Prebon everything that was happening.
> > 
> > His shoulder blasters charge up again, but Striker stops himself 
> from 
> > firing. He couldn't do it, he couldn't shoot Spears.
> > 
> > "Hey," he says, an idea occuring to him, "Can you go fetch
Prebon? 
> I 
> > need to speak to
